actions.text: Amendment SA 1357 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

Amendment SA 1357 proposed by Senator Byrd for Senator Reid. (consideration:  CR S9783-9785; text:  CR S9784) To express the sense of the Senate that the Secretary of Homeland Security should take into account tourist population as a factor when determining resource needs and potential vulnerabilities for the purpose of allocating funds for discretionary and formula grants.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 1357 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 1357 proposed by Senator Byrd for Senator Reid.

purpose: To express the sense of the Senate that the Secretary of Homeland Security should take into account tourist population as a factor when determining resource needs and potential vulnerabilities for the purpose of allocating funds for discretionary and formula grants.
